title: Sungevity And Mosaic Partner On Competitive Solar Loan To Address Growing Demand For Ownership
text:
Sungevity, Inc.
Leading Solar Platform Companies Offer Affordable Full-Purchase Option that Enables Customers to Gain Direct Access to Solar Incentives
OAKLAND, Calif. , Oct. 12, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Sungevity, Inc ., a leader in the international solar market, together with solar project finance company Mosaic , today announced a new solar loan solution that makes solar ownership more accessible and affordable for homeowners. This collaboration is the latest example of Sungevity's strategy to proliferate the adoption of solar through partnerships with the most innovative companies in the industry.
The joint offering from Sungevity and Mosaic features a turnkey, technology-based solution to finance solar systems with preferred interest rates, no money down and low monthly payments. The solar loan unlocks the federal solar investment tax credit as well as both state and local rebates for customers. Customers first access Sungevity's proprietary iQuote: technology and then apply for instant approval up to $100,000 through Mosaic's simple online portal. Sungevity handles solar system design and installation, and will manage ongoing system maintenance and monitoring-- two service components that are typically limited to leased systems. Sungevity also guarantees the system's performance for 20 years. The result is a frictionless experience for the customer that is both simple and economical.
"Our two companies have always shared a vision to advance solar adoption by providing an exceptional customer experience," said commented Andrew Birch , CEO, Sungevity. "Now, as industry experts and providers of leading technology-based solutions, we are working jointly to provide customers with more choice by addressing the growing demand for solar ownership."
Among the top residential solar installers, Sungevity is currently offering Mosaic loans for grid-tied residential solar installations in California , Connecticut , Massachusetts , New Jersey , New Mexico , New York and North Carolina , and will soon expand to Delaware , Maryland and Rhode Island . The growing trend of direct ownership brings associated benefits for the homeowner, most notably increasing home values and state-specific incentives.
"Mosaic and Sungevity believe that one of the fastest ways to make U.S. communities stronger is through more affordable and accessible solar ownership," said Billy Parish , CEO & Co-Founder, Mosaic. "Integrating Mosaic's loan with Sungevity's incredible network of customers and proven technology platform gives millions of U.S. homeowners real access to the benefits of energy independence that solar provides."
For more information, visit www.joinmosaic.com .
ABOUT SUNGEVITY
Sungevity is a global solar energy provider focused on making it easy and affordable for homeowners and businesses to benefit from solar power. Leveraging proprietary remote solar design technology, Sungevity can deliver a Quote: without a physical site visit and provide prospective customers with immediate visibility to potential savings on their electricity bills. The company continues to grow its global customer base and now services 12 U.S. states, the District of Columbia , the Netherlands . Sungevity also is the residential solar partner to Lowe's, and was recognized last year by B Corp as one of the "Best for the World" companies for using the power of business to solve social and environmental problems. For more information, visit www.sungevity.com .
ABOUT MOSAIC
Mosaic is America's marketplace lender for solar power. We utilize technology, data, and design to efficiently and responsibly lend people money to go solar. We leverage our platform to advance one of the biggest opportunities for humanity-the transition to 100% clean energy.
Mosaic has been named a top-ten most innovative energy company by Fast Company in 2013 and 2014 and has received two Department of Energy SunShot grants, the Sierra Club's Trailblazer Award and Verizon Wireless' Powerful Answers Award.
